Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery amphora; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of warrior (only part of leg and shield with added red rim and part of device consisting of leg in added white remaining), presumable facing left if the shield is on the left arm.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
There are possible traces of miltos sticking on the interior of the amphora.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0082) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
